Jason,
   Would it be correct to say that the application of the HyperNEAT =

approach to a problem, would be:

a) the evolution of a CPPN network with =
problem inputs and outputs 
configured as inputs to the CPPN, and the outpu=
t of which being the 
problem connection weight,

b) the expansion of avail=
able activation functions within the CPPN 
nodes, allowing exploitation of =
underlying functional relationships 
of the problem inputs and outputs, and=


c) anticipated computational savings due to evolution of only the 
CPPN, =
and only evaluation overhead of the problem network(?)

   I'm just trying =
to identify the applicability, given the apparent 
increase in dimensions a=
ssociated with problems in which actual 
geometry (as opposed to problem pa=
rameter space), is applicable. 
Thanks for publishing your work and code.

=
Thanks,
   Andy Carl
